attributes.action: We need Asian History to be a part of the school curriculum all over the UK.
attributes.background: We would like for the Government/Parliament to broaden the school curriculum and teach the history of the Asian race. This would include the roots of the Asian race, the discrimination the Asian race face, the attempts to change this, how we can change, and what happens on day to day life.
attributes.additional_details: This is very important to us as hate crimes towards the Asian race are on the rise, especially in schools. These may start as small words but can grow into huge actions. By teaching this in schools, we aim for students to embrace and respect the history of the Asian race and understand the severe discrimination that is faced on a day to day basis and why it is wrong. This will also create a safe space in schools for all students, creating a more equal and understanding learning environment.

attributes.action: Change mobile phone sales for under 16's.
attributes.background: Any mobile phone that is sold for use by a child under 16 must be accompanied by a government warning. This should include online information to lead parents to sites on online safety, regulations and help with associated issues.
attributes.additional_details:
The online environment has insufficient independent regulation to prevent significant harm (including loss of life) to our youngsters.
The companies providing social media are using their economic influence to avoid regulation and only seek to maximise their profits in this vulnerable population group.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do.  We're not sure whether you want warnings for children or parents and what you'd like to be covered by "sold for use by a child under 16".  

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Working from home - save the environment
attributes.background: Working from home should be offered for all desk job staff in small, medium and large businesses in the UK. Employees should be offered the choice to maintain such jobs: choosing to work in office full-time; part-time and home; or full-time from home. Less commuting translates to less air pollution.
attributes.additional_details: I request that the UK government enact a law, mandating that businesses offer, without prejudice, the right to desk job employees to choose to work from home as an ongoing practice. If employees have worked from home during lockdown, this should automatically entitle them to continue to do so. Where employees work part-time from home and part-time from the office, this should also be allowed to continue.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/570934

attributes.action: Lower grade boundaries for GCSE exams in 2022
attributes.background: Lower the grade boundaries for GCSEs in 2022
attributes.additional_details:
During lockdown, students were put at a disadvantage for learning, mainly due to a lack in a classroom atmosphere which leads to students being less motivated to do classwork at home. Additionally, students would be more distracted in home environments as there aren't any guarantees of no distractions during the lesson.
This puts students at a particular disadvantage for their GCSE exams as there will have been content which they have missed out on. Lowering grade boundaries would be fair.

attributes.action: Run a UK awareness Campaign on the damage fly tipping does to our environment
attributes.background:
Actions: Run a UK awareness Campaign against fly tipping. Make penalties tougher & financially resource the Environmental Agency & Councils to be able to catch fly tippers.
Incentivise business to offer new for old delivery & take away schemes for bulky goods.
attributes.additional_details:
There are over a million fly tipping incidents every year, costing the UK over £100m to clear, these fly tips damage the environment & blight local communities .There is no co-ordinated national campaign to change attitudes to fly tipping & make it a social stigma.Penalties & enforcement are too weak.
The culture of the minority that fly tip needs to be changed through education & enforcement ,led & funded by Government across the U.K.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/575382

attributes.action: Fund plastic recycling processing plants and ban the export of plastic waste
attributes.background: Plastic waste processing plants should be built across the UK. Plastic waste should be processed in a way to minimize environmental harm. Within three years the export of plastic waste should be banned.
attributes.additional_details:
The UK’s approach to plastic recycling is a sham and the environmental harm being caused is immoral.

As seen on TV, much of the UK’s plastic waste is being exported to places like Turkey and Asia, where much of the waste is burned, poisoning the environment.

If the UK builds sufficient plastic waste processing plants, we can take responsibility for our own waste, and stop exporting our problem.

This will create jobs, reduce environmental harm, and improve the UK’s international reputation.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/586467

attributes.action: Gcse and A-Level Grading reform
attributes.background: To change the way the final grades are assessed. By not having exams as the final say. But instead, use a number of factors like: Attitude to learning, homework, classwork, small controlled assessments.
attributes.additional_details: Reforming the way final grades are assessed can give more chance to the students who find exams difficult, a chance to achieve higher grades. And it would avoid stress for some, which maintains their mental health. Final exams are also unfair because if a student has an "off-day" and they underpreform, the student may have a hard time finding employment as their exam grade do not reflect their true potential. Grades should be assessed in a natural work-like environment such as the classroom.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/570550

attributes.action: Legalise e-scooters so people can travel to work and reduce congestion
attributes.background: Make e-scooters legal to anyone over the age of 18 to commute to work. Its better for traffic and the environment, Its easier for people to travel that can't ride a bike and don't have a driving licence. I do think people over the age of 18 will be more responsible.
attributes.additional_details: Because all we are seeing now is damage by global warming all caused by emissions from motor vehicles etc. This would help people get to work and not be stuck in traffic. Especially those who don't have a driving licence and can't ride a bike. E-scooters would be perfect to the more responsible adult.

rejection.details:
You might like to sign the following petition:

Legalize the use of e-scooters where bikes can be used.
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/583107

attributes.action: Reintroduce packing/bagging options for home delivery groceries
attributes.background: We are all aware of how devastating plastic bags can be to the environment, supermarkets have already made the  change to no longer provide plastic bags for home deliveries, but there should be an option for items to be pre bagged or boxed still, possibly using recyclable materials or rented bags.
attributes.additional_details: Having loose groceries arrive while many are still unable or uncomfortable to let drivers into their home to help them unpack makes the elderly and disabled customers more vulnerable, and unpacking at the door can be extremely difficult or impossible, causing long term physical discomfort. Many delivery drivers have expressed concern how deliveries are becoming late and more difficult for them also.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you are concerned about packaging of groceries delivered to the home, but we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do.

The UK Government has introduced a requirement for retailers to charge for single use carrier bags in England, although this requirement was suspended for home deliveries from 21 March 2020 to 21 September 2020, due to the Covid-19 outbreak.

It is up to individual retailers what packaging options to offer customers, but they must charge for single use carrier bags if these are offered.

We could accept a petition calling for the plastic bag charge to be permanently exempted for home deliveries, or some other change to the plastic bag charge, but we can't accept requests for supermarkets to change the options they provide, as this is a matter for them, not the Government or House of Commons.

attributes.action: Introduce mandatory education on politics to the secondary curriculum.
attributes.background: The Government should introduce politics education to the secondary curriculum, with it being treated in much the same way as Religious Education, so that young people have a firm understanding of how the country is run, by whom and in which ways the public influence the decision making process.
attributes.additional_details: Given the current, very turbulent state of politics, both in the UK and out, I feel that young people should be educated on the political world at large. This should include the systems both in the UK and globally and their respective political processes; and how politicians garner support, from whom and why. Educating young people on these matters could, in my opinion, lessen the division we see in modern politics, and should seek to create a less hostile environment for discussion.

rejection.details:
Politics is already included as part of the statutory citizenship curriculum. You can find out more here:

https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/national-curriculum-in-england-citizenship-programmes-of-study

You might like to sign this petition:

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/573999

attributes.action: Keep the Nightingale Hospital’s open for homeless veterans and all homeless.
attributes.background: Keep the Nightingale Hospital’s open for homeless veterans and the general homeless.
attributes.additional_details: Keep the Nightingale Hospital’s open for homeless veterans and the general homeless, giving them a safe and warm environment and the necessary rehabilitation.

rejection.details:

We could accept a petition calling on the Government to increase funding for NHS services for veterans and homeless people, if that's what you want to happen.

We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Provide more support for military veterans with PTSD: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/556084

Require local authorities to have free helplines for the homeless and vulnerable: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/562213

attributes.action: Make it a criminal offence to hit an animal with a vehicle and drive off
attributes.background: I believe it should be made a criminal offence to knock down someone's pet and drive away ie hit and run of a pet. If the pet was to accidentally to escape from their home or garden and someone hits the pet with their vehicle they should pay half of the vet bill if not the full vet bill.
attributes.additional_details: I want the government to do this because pets can escape from even secure environments and even if the owner realised the pet had escaped straight away it could be too late. If a pet is injured by a vehicle the vet bill can be quite costly which isn't fair on the owner if they don't realise their pet has escaped from their home and if the pet was to die not only do they lose their pet that could even be there lifeline but they also have to pay quite abit of money to cremate the pet

rejection.details:
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/566080

It's already an offence to hit a dog and fail to report it.  

We could accept a petition calling for it to be a legal requirement to report hitting any animal, if you'd like something different to the current law and open petition.

attributes.action: back a moratorium on seabed mining
attributes.background: To back a moratorium on deep seabed mining until more research has been done to evaluate the possible environmental impact this may have.
attributes.additional_details: The move towards electric cars requires minerals to make the batteries that come from a small number of countries, hence companies are looking to mine deep seabeds. Little research has been done to date of what effects this can have on marine environment. More time needs to be given for research to continue before embarking on deep seabed mining.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. We're not sure whether you want a UK moratorium on deep sea mining, or for the UK Government to work internationally on a global ban. 
	
You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Introduce virtual driving theory tests.
attributes.background: Make it possible for the driving theory test to be taken at home to reduce the waiting list and get people driving quicker.
attributes.additional_details: Lockdown has coursed an uncountable amount of problems for the country, and for a lot people my age and even older it has put a massive delay on us obtaining our driving licences. The waiting list for driving theory tests already goes all the way to July and is only going to increase, I believe that theory tests should be able to be taken at home in a controlled environment so that more people have the opportunity to be on the roads quicker.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/570878

attributes.action: End the measurement of vehicle emissions as 'tailpipe only' to allow clean fuels
attributes.background: Government must end 'tailpipe only' measure as it doesn't consider other environmental costs such as battery manufacture. Allow sale of electrofuels / efuels & biomethane new cars after 2030 to reduce & reverse CO2 levels. We must reduce Lithium extraction as it is very damaging to the environment.
attributes.additional_details:
Clean fuels use normal petrol or diesel pumps, no need for environmentally damaging charger installs everywhere.
Battery manufacture creates high co2 emissions, adds cost & Lithium is not renewable!
Charging cars is not practical for lots of people.
Cobalt mining is still using Child Labour.
Biomethane can be CO2 negative full lifecycle.
Biomethane is biodiverse & can be made from waste reducing pollution.
Combustion cars, vans, trucks etc. are more affordable for people or business on a budget.

Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/563118

attributes.action: Put more bins in London
attributes.background: We want the government to put more Bins in London because otherwise, people will litter and that is bad for the environment.
attributes.additional_details: We want more bins because there are not enough bins and so that people don't litter and put their rubbish in the bins.

attributes.action: Restrict junk mail, or allow an opt-out option, for environmental reasons.
attributes.background:
Each week I receive many pieces of junk mail, booklets, flyers, menus, and it all goes into the bin or recycling without a second look.
It's an extremely wasteful practice.
I'd like new laws or guidance in place to restrict unsolicited mail, or at least allow an opt-out or digital alternative.
attributes.additional_details: In a time when resources are depleting, energy use is under scrutiny and the environment is being polluted more and more by human waste, this unnecessary practice is out of date, particularly when digital alternatives are available.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. We understand you're concerned about junk mail, but we're not sure how you'd like it to be restricted
	
You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do, such as creating an opt-out service.

attributes.action: Change the law to allow electric scooters on UK roads
attributes.background: The current UK law states that you can ride an electric bike, drive a car or even saddle up a horse on the road, but you can’t ride a privately owned electric scooter. And people during this pandemic want to commute to work or using the escooter for delivery services but are struggling to do so.
attributes.additional_details:
So If the Government made it legal, electric scooters could offer a number of benefits. They offer an alternative to using public transport – for shorter journeys such as commuting to work or delivering goods to their customers using their own escooter, they take minutes to set up and are simple to ride and they are better for the environment, helping to ease congestion and address pollution problems.
And the people will be able to use them for their own benefits. And make life much more easier

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/553756

Government fund for women to afford self defence essentials&

attributes.action: Ban water sold in single use plastic bottles.
attributes.background: I’m asking the government to prevent the sale of water in single use plastic bottles to reduce the rate of plastic consumption in the UK.
attributes.additional_details:
Bottled water is pointless and dangerous. It's suffocating marine animals, leaching micro plastics into our water supplies and contains chemicals that harm human health. 
Plastic is not sustainable. Its main component is alkenes obtained from oil, and it can't be recycled indefinitely. 
Plastic is polluting the environment, it’s bad for human health and it’s not sustainable. We have got to stop being so dependent on it and must remove unnecessary plastic items.

attributes.action: Ban the insecticide fipronil from all UK pet flea & tick products
attributes.background: The Government needs to ban the insecticide fipronil from all pet flea and tick products in the UK to protect the fish in our rivers. The UK's wildlife is already vulnerable and this toxic chemical is damaging our aquatic life, despite only being found in flea products.
attributes.additional_details: Fipronil is an insecticide that was banned by the EU for agricultural purposes in 2017. It is still a common ingredient in pet flea treatments, but is highly toxic to fish. Fipronil enters our waterways through household drains from washing our pets, their bedding and our hands. It was found in 99% of rivers studied and breaks down into a product 3 to 6 times more toxic. One dog can kill an entire pond of fish when treated with fipronil. It needs to be removed from our environment and homes.

rejection.details:
You may like to sign this petition which we currently have open:

Ban the sale and use of Fipronil and Imidacloprid in flea treatments for pets
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/560905

attributes.additional_details:
Bottled water is pointless and dangerous. It's suffocating marine animals, leaching micro plastics into our water supplies and contains chemicals that harm human health.
Plastic is not sustainable. Its main component is alkenes obtained from  oil, and it can't be recycled indefinitely. 
Plastic is polluting the environment, it’s bad for human health and it’s not sustainable. We have got to stop being so dependent on it and must remove unnecessary plastic items.

attributes.action: Don't make the wearing of face masks compulsory in classrooms.
attributes.background: I would like the Government to commit to not making face masks compulsory for pupils in the classroom environment, when they return to school on 8th March.
attributes.additional_details:
The overwhelming majority of children and young people have no symptoms or very mild illness only. Covering the face in school all day will have a huge negative impact on children and young people.
Face masks prevent the mirroring of facial expressions, they impair verbal and non verbal communication, and they block emotional signaling between teachers and pupils. The wearing of face masks potentially leads to a significant increase in socio-psychological stress. Children and young people have suffered enough during the COVID 19 pandemic.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/576843

attributes.action: Disband / scrutinize Sadiq Khan's unelected 'Commission for Diversity' group.
attributes.background: Mayor Sadiq Khan’s ‘Commission for Diversity in the Public Realm’ (made up of an unelected group of individuals) aims to ‘enrich and add to the current public realm’. This group has taken it upon themselves to ‘review London's historic monuments and statues’ with no public input or democratic vote.
attributes.additional_details: This is problematic as these unelected individuals fail to recognise that these monuments aren’t just representative of London, but England as a whole. It’s unfair and undemocratic to put a small group of people in charge of regulating the history of the country based on what they deem appropriate. Also, for a panel encouraging diversity, there is a noticeable lack in variety of political views, creating an environment that does not reflect the diversity of thought that England is known for.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government aren't responsible for the issue you raise. This is a matter for the London Assembly and the London Mayor.

The London Assembly has its own petitions process. You can find out more about how to petition the London Assembly here: https://www.london.gov.uk/about-us/london-assembly/petitions

attributes.action: Stop off-road vehicles ruining our countryside.More policing & stiffer penalties
attributes.background: Section 34 Road Traffic Act 1988 needs enforcing more strictly with arrests, bigger fines, vehicle confiscation & prosecutions to deter the huge increase in recreational off-road vehicle usage on grazing/common land which is damaging the livestock, our wildlife, environment and rural communities
attributes.additional_details: Local wildlife, farmers, communities have relied on moorlands for generations and these vital peatlands are under threat with livestock unable to graze safely now. These illegal, vehicle users are shredding moorland to pieces. This problem has grown over the years and the increase is mainly adults using our moorland to exercise off-road bikes/4x4s and has now reached an overwhelming level.The huge increase in this illegal activity is damaging breeding grounds and the environment to a huge level

rejection.details:
Driving a 'mechanically propelled' vehicle on moorland is already an offence under the Road Traffic Act 1988, so it's not clear how you would like the law to be changed nor what you mean by 'stiffer penalties'. 

Further, enforcement of the law is a matter for the Police, not the UK Government or Parliament.

You could start a petition calling for increased minimum sentences for offences under Section 34 of the Road Traffic Act, if that's something you'd like to happen.

attributes.action: Create a more solid process to access risk of someone before discharge.
attributes.background:
Create a supportive structured plan of assessing needs that If people feel suicidal and presents them self at a local hospital or a place of safety this would not be invalidating and should then be placed in a safe environment eg hospital to prevent harm to a individual. 
More training needed
attributes.additional_details: There needs to be change , there are to many death rates from suicide or attempts individuals trying to commit suicide then sent home with no plans in place , individuals need to be able to access a wide variety of support that’s suits them and there needs , by making individuals believe they have a supported plan for there needs the likely hood of them trying to commit suicide might be lower and also individuals will start to trust mental health services and then become a lower risk to harm and vulnerability.

attributes.action: Make teachers a priority for the vaccine and get children back to school
attributes.background: I would like the government to put school staff as a priority for the vaccine, help get children back to school quicker.
attributes.additional_details: Children and parents are at home struggling to juggle workand home schooling. Some children don’t have the equipment for homeschooling, it is so important for children to socialise with other children and learn in a different environment. Some children struggle mentally and being at school is a safe haven for them and an escape. School is so important and teachers are so important. Children need school and parents need time to work. Add teachers to the priority group for the vaccine

attributes.action: Restart dredging the rivers to stop the flooding. Stop building on flood plains.
attributes.background: Now that we have left the EU we should start dredging the rivers again to stop the flooding. Stop building on flood plains will also help with the natural order of nature.
attributes.additional_details: We never had no where near as much flooding as we do now when the rivers were dredged on a regular basis. The sludge could be used on the fields as natural fertiliser the rivers would flow better, natural drainage all round. So much better for the environment and will save billions in insurance claims and no more devastated home owners losing everything year on year in flood areas.

rejection.details:
Dredging and the removal of silt and sand from main rivers is regulated under the Environmental Permitting Regulations 2010, but decisions about dredging of individual rivers is a matter for individual local authorities and the Environment Agency, not the Government or House of Commons.

EU laws did affect decisions about dredging, but the practice was not banned while the UK was a member of the EU. You can read more about this here: https://fullfact.org/online/EU-dredging-floods/

We could accept a petition calling on the Government to ban development on flood plains, and review guidance on dredding of rivers, if that is something you want to happen.

attributes.action: Stop the UK setting up the new deep coal mine in Cumbria.
attributes.background: The government must intervene and stop the creation of the mine. Show the country that the impact of fossil fuels on our planet is not a “local issue”. Each decision made that will be a detriment to our environment must be scrutinised and evaluated on a national level before it is approved.
attributes.additional_details: The impact and fight against Climate change will define our planet for the next hundred years. With the U.K. aiming to champion the transition to a greener economy, the existence of proposals like this will make us a laughing stock in the global community. Post-Brexit; at a time where we need to secure our position as a prominent global figure, we need to innovate the industries of the future and bury the outdated methods of the past.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/568475

attributes.action: Reject Gavin Williamson’s “External Tests” for 2021 GCSE and A’Level grading.
attributes.background: Children in their exam years 2021 have had their education terribly disrupted. The governments continual inability to give clear direction is damaging these children educationally and mentally. Potential “ External Tests” reintroduce exams by the back door. End this uncertainty and reject them.
attributes.additional_details: Students are struggling physically and mentally working from home and have been told by the government there will be no exams for 2021 and they will be graded by their teachers. External Tests just ramp up greater stress on a fragile learning environment. End the uncertainty now and keep it simple. Trust the teaching profession and go with in house teacher assessments for 2021.  Reject external tests.

Cancel GCSE and A-levels in 2021 replace with Course Work and Teacher Assessment: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/564696

attributes.action: Ban the production and use of Neonicotinoid pesticides
attributes.background: Environment secretary George Eustice has agreed to let a product containing the neonicotinoid thiamethoxam to treat sugar beet seed this year in an effort to protect the crop from a virus. This will be devastating for our bee population. Ban the production and usage of all Neonicotinoid pesticides.
attributes.additional_details:
Neonicotinoids pose a significant environmental risk, particularly to bees and other pollinators.

A third of the UK bee population is thought to have vanished in a decade, yet up to three-quarters of crop species are pollinated by bees, studies show. 

A 2017 study of 33 oilseed rape sites in the UK, Germany and Hungary found a link between higher levels of neonicotinoid residues and lower bee reproduction, with fewer queens in bumblebee hives and fewer egg cells in solitary bee nests.

attributes.action: Replace New Year's Fireworks with Only Light and Drone Show
attributes.background: Fireworks cause extensive air pollution in a very short amount of time, and leave metal particles, dangerous toxins, harmful chemicals and smoke in the air for hours and days. Most of which never fully decompose, and instead stay in the environment, causing harm to animals, plants etc.
attributes.additional_details: The 2021 New Year's Firework event, was called the "most environmentally-friendly New Year’s Eve event to date", by the London Mayor, since it included drones and lighting.
